Test Steps:
1. Navigate to app homepage
2. Click 'Sign in with Google' button
3. Enter Google credentials
4. Grant permissions
Expected Result: User is redirected to dashboard with logged-in state

Test Steps:
1. Login with Google
2. Close browser
3. Reopen app
Expected Result: User remains logged in, no re-authentication needed

Test Steps:
1. Click logout button
2. Confirm logout
Expected Result: User is logged out, redirected to login page

Test Steps:
1. Click 'New Note' button
2. Enter title
3. Enter content
Expected Result: New note is created, appears in note list

Test Steps:
1. Click on note from list
2. Modify title or content
3. Wait 2 seconds (auto-save)
Expected Result: Changes are saved automatically, UI shows save indicator

Test Steps:
1. Click on note
2. Click delete button
3. Confirm deletion
Expected Result: Note is moved to trash, removed from main list

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to trash
2. Select deleted note
3. Click restore button
Expected Result: Note is restored to main list with original content

Test Steps:
1. Delete a note
2. Wait 30 days (or simulate)
Expected Result: Note is permanently removed from database

Test Steps:
1. Open note editor
2. Select text
3. Click bold button (or Ctrl+B)
Expected Result: Selected text becomes bold

Test Steps:
1. Select text
2. Click italic button (or Ctrl+I)
Expected Result: Selected text becomes italic

Test Steps:
1. Type text
2. Select heading level from toolbar (H1-H6)
Expected Result: Text is formatted as heading with correct level

Test Steps:
1. Click bullet list button
2. Type list items
Expected Result: Bulleted list is created with proper formatting

Test Steps:
1. Click numbered list button
2. Type list items
Expected Result: Numbered list is created with proper formatting

Test Steps:
1. Click code block button
2. Type code
Expected Result: Code block is created with monospace font

Test Steps:
1. Select text
2. Click link button
3. Enter URL
Expected Result: Text becomes clickable link

Test Steps:
1. Start typing in note
2. Wait 2 seconds without typing
Expected Result: Note is auto-saved, save indicator shows

Test Steps:
1. Create note with explicit keywords: TASK: DESC: AC: COMMENT:
2. Click 'Create Jira Task' button
Expected Result: Task data is correctly parsed and displayed in preview

Test Steps:
1. Write note with: 'Fix authentication bug'
2. Add: 'Users unable to login'
3. Add: 'Must complete OAuth flow'
4. Click 'Create Jira Task'
Expected Result: Task, description, and AC are correctly detected

Test Steps:
1. Parse note as Jira task
2. Confirm task details
3. Click 'Create Issue'
Expected Result: Jira issue is created, issue key is displayed (e.g., PROJ-123)

Test Steps:
1. Edit note linked to Jira issue
2. Click 'Update Jira Task'
Expected Result: Jira issue is updated with new content

Test Steps:
1. Go to Settings
2. Enter Jira domain, email, API token
3. Select default project and issue type
4. Save configuration
Expected Result: Jira credentials are saved (encrypted), connection is verified

Test Steps:
1. Create Jira issue from note
2. Check note details
Expected Result: Note shows Jira issue link, clicking opens Jira in new tab

Test Steps:
1. Go to Settings
2. Click 'Connect Gmail'
3. Authorize OAuth permissions
4. Grant access
Expected Result: Gmail is connected, access tokens are stored

Test Steps:
1. Open note
2. Click 'Email' button
3. Enter recipient email
4. Click 'Send'
Expected Result: Email is sent with note content, success notification shown

Test Steps:
1. Create Jira task from note
2. Click 'Email task summary'
3. Enter recipient
4. Send
Expected Result: Email contains task details and Jira link

Test Steps:
1. Open note
2. Click 'Email' button
3. Check 'Attach as markdown'
4. Send
Expected Result: Email includes .md file attachment

Test Steps:
1. Open note
2. Click 'Email' button
3. Select template
4. Verify variables are replaced ({{noteTitle}}, etc.)
5. Send
Expected Result: Email uses template with correct variable substitution

Test Steps:
1. Send 50 emails within an hour
2. Attempt to send 51st email
Expected Result: Error message: 'Rate limit exceeded, try again later'

Test Steps:
1. Click 'Sync with Folder'
2. File picker opens
3. Select folder
4. Grant permissions
Expected Result: Folder is selected, permission granted

Test Steps:
1. Select folder with .md files
2. Click 'Import'
Expected Result: All .md files are imported as notes, YAML frontmatter parsed

Test Steps:
1. Edit .md file in local folder
2. Save file
Expected Result: App detects change, updates note in database

Test Steps:
1. Edit note in app
2. Wait for auto-save
Expected Result: Local .md file is updated with new content

Test Steps:
1. Edit same note in app and local file simultaneously
2. Save both
Expected Result: Last write wins, sync status shows conflict warning

Test Steps:
1. Make changes to note
2. Observe sync status icon
Expected Result: Icons change: ⟳ syncing → ✓ synced

Test Steps:
1. Import .md file with YAML frontmatter (title, tags, date)
2. Check note details
Expected Result: Metadata is correctly parsed into note fields

Test Steps:
1. Open note
2. Type '#' and tag name
3. Press Enter
Expected Result: New tag is created and applied to note

Test Steps:
1. Add tag 'work'
2. Add tag 'important'
Expected Result: Both tags appear on note, color-coded

Test Steps:
1. Click on tag in sidebar
2. View filtered notes
Expected Result: Only notes with selected tag are shown

Test Steps:
1. Select tag 'work'
2. Hold Ctrl, select tag 'urgent'
Expected Result: Notes with either tag are shown

Test Steps:
1. Start typing tag name
2. Observe suggestions
Expected Result: Existing tags appear as suggestions

Test Steps:
1. Go to tag management
2. Select tag
3. Click delete
Expected Result: Tag is removed from all notes

Test Steps:
1. Enter 'authentication' in search bar
2. Press Enter
Expected Result: Notes with 'authentication' in title are shown

Test Steps:
1. Enter 'OAuth' in search bar
2. Press Enter
Expected Result: Notes containing 'OAuth' in content are shown

Test Steps:
1. Start typing in search bar
2. Observe results as you type
Expected Result: Results update in real-time with each keystroke

Test Steps:
1. Search for 'login'
2. View results
Expected Result: 'login' is highlighted in note previews

Test Steps:
1. Search for non-existent term
2. View results
Expected Result: 'No notes found' message displayed

Test Steps:
1. Click 'Share' on note
2. Enter email address
3. Select 'View' permission
4. Click 'Send invitation'
Expected Result: Invitation email sent, recipient can view but not edit

Test Steps:
1. Click 'Share' on note
2. Enter email address
3. Select 'Edit' permission
4. Send invitation
Expected Result: Recipient can view and edit note

Test Steps:
1. Receive share invitation
2. Click link in email
3. Sign in with Google
Expected Result: Shared note is accessible with correct permissions

Test Steps:
1. Open shared note (Edit permission)
2. Two users edit simultaneously
Expected Result: Both users see changes in real-time, cursors visible

Test Steps:
1. Open shared note
2. Check collaborators section
Expected Result: All users with access are listed with permissions

Test Steps:
1. Open shared note (owner)
2. Click on collaborator
3. Click 'Revoke access'
Expected Result: User loses access, cannot view note anymore

Test Steps:
1. Open shared note (owner)
2. Change collaborator from 'View' to 'Edit'
3. Save changes
Expected Result: Collaborator can now edit note

Test Steps:
1. Open app on fresh browser
2. Measure load time
Expected Result: Page fully loads in under 2 seconds

Test Steps:
1. Click dark mode toggle
2. Observe UI changes
Expected Result: All UI elements switch to dark theme

Test Steps:
1. Open app on mobile device (or resize browser)
2. Test all features
Expected Result: UI adapts to mobile screen, all features work

Test Steps:
1. Use Ctrl+B for bold
2. Use Ctrl+S to save
3. Use Ctrl+K for search
Expected Result: All keyboard shortcuts function correctly

Test Steps:
1. Logout
2. Try to access /notes URL directly
Expected Result: Redirected to login page

Test Steps:
1. User A creates note
2. User B attempts to access User A's note (direct API call)
Expected Result: Access denied, error returned

Test Steps:
1. Configure Jira/Gmail
2. Check database
Expected Result: API tokens are stored encrypted, not plain text

Test Steps:
1. Type rapidly in note
2. Observe save requests
Expected Result: Only 1 save request after 2 seconds of no typing

Test Steps:
1. Create 1000+ notes
2. Perform search
3. Measure response time
Expected Result: Search completes in <500ms

Test Steps:
1. Disconnect internet
2. Edit note
3. Wait for auto-save
Expected Result: Error message shown, retry option available

Test Steps:
1. Enter invalid Jira credentials
2. Attempt to create issue
Expected Result: Clear error message: 'Invalid credentials, check settings'

Test Steps:
1. Revoke Gmail access from Google account
2. Try to send email
Expected Result: Error: 'Gmail access revoked, please reconnect'
